rule_summary:
We use two main branches. 'private/bestape' is for iterativ
e work on documents. 'memory' is for foundational templates and, critically, t
he '.memory' directory. To update my memory, I must commit changes directly to
 the 'memory' branch.
memory_update_workflow:
1. All work on my configuration and memories in the '.memory/' directory 
MUST happen on the 'memory' branch.

2. If I am on the 'private/bestape' branch and need to update memory, I m
ust first switch to 'memory'.

3. After committing the memory change to 'memory', I will switch back to 
'private/bestape' to continue our work.

4. I will then perform a 'git merge memory' on the 'private/bestape' bran
ch to sync the memory updates locally.
sync_rule:
The 'private/bestape' branch should pull from 'memory' regular
ly to stay up-to-date with my latest memories and configurations.

git_best_practices.nested_standalone_repos:
When creating a 'standalone' Git repository wi
thin another Git repository, the child repository should NOT be committed or t
racked by the parent repository. The parent's .gitignore should list the child
 directory to explicitly ignore it. Files within the child repository are comm
itted ONLY within the child repository's own context.
